thread.title: Michigan Punter Speaks After Fumbled Snap Led to Loss Against Michigan State
thread.title_full: Michigan Punter Speaks After Fumbled Snap Led to Loss Against Michigan State

author: Kelly Terez
title: Michigan Punter Speaks After Fumbled Snap Led to Loss Against Michigan State
text:
WXYZ-TV (ANN ARBOR, Mich.) -- Michigan's Blake O'Neill is speaking out for the first time after the fumbled punt snap from over the weekend. 
“It’s been interesting,” said O'Neill on Tuesday. “That’s for sure.” 
During the Michigan and Michigan State game on Saturday, the Wolverines were leading 23-20 with 10 seconds left on the clock. Michigan's punter, O'Neill, fumbled a punt snap which Michigan State recovered, with Jalen Watts-Jackson taking the ball to the endzone to score a touchdown just as the clock ran out. 
O'Neill received a variety of death threats and hateful comments on social media a day after the game, leading Michigan's interim athletic director Jim Hackett to post a letter telling fans to stop the "thoughtless comments" after the loss. 
“The support from the Michigan community has been fantastic,” O’Neill said. "It means a lot for people to take time out of their day to write me.” 
Copyright   Tuesday, October 20, 2015 at 8:07PM
